alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:07PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bell, south central Knox, southeastern McCreary and southern Whitley Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ayers, or 7 miles south of Williamsburg, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pleasant View around 615 PM EDT. Mountain Ash around 620 PM EDT. Red Ash and Saxton around 625 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lot, Packard, Polly Camp, Wilkerson and Pruden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
